author: Special Correspondent
text:
To cater to the rush of passengers during Pongal, the State government on Thursday announced it would ply over 12,600 special buses across the State between January 9 and 19.

As for Chennai city, about 600 special buses would be plied during the period and about 200 more special buses would be plied on Kanum Pongal (January 17) to places like Marina beach, Mamallapuram.

Of the 12,624 special buses, about 4,600 of them would start from Chennai Mofussil Bus Terminus (CMBT) at Koyambedu and about 7,900 buses would be plied from different towns across the State between January 9 and 19, Chief Minister Jayalalithaa said in a statement.

For travel beyond 300 km, reservations can be made through www.tnstc.in and a total of 25 special reservation counters would be set up for this purpose, she said.

Private buses ticket fare

“I have ordered officials to ensure that fixed bus fare is collected from passengers in private buses. If more fare is collected, the public can dial 044-24794709 to register their complaint. I have directed officials to take action on the complaints immediately,” she added.
title: 12,624 special buses during Pongal
